channel.title: Git on Hugo Ivy
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Hugo Ivy

item.title: BitBucket
item.description: BitBucket start Create a new account in BitBucket Create a new repository on BitBucket Clone the repository git clone https://username@bitbucket.org/username/test.git git remote add origin https://kkarthik23@bitbucket.org/kkarthik23/powershell.git git add . git commit -m "Initial commit" git push -u origin master To commit changes for new file git add TestFile.txt git commit -m "updated file" git push - u origin master

item.title: GIT and Vagrant
item.description: GIT GIT is a Distributed Version Control System Some commands are create a new repository on the command line echo “# website” >> README.md git init git add README.md git commit -m "first commit" git remote add origin https://github.com/Username/website.git git push -u origin master or push an existing repository from the command line git remote add origin https://github.com/Username/website.git git push -u origin master View remote and remove git remote -v git remote rm destination git remote -v BitBucket Step 1:Push your local repo cd /path/to/your/repo Step 2: Connect your existing repository to Bitbucket git remote add origin https://username@bitbucket.
